results.title: The Seventh continent (Anamorphic)
results.creator_credit: Dusan Vukoric, Fimove Studio Koliba and Jadran Film (Zagreb)
results.brief_description: Two runaway children discover a magical island, the Seventh Continent. Soon, children of various nationalities and races come to the Seventh Continent where they create a new world of fun and fantasy far from adults. A Yugoslav-Czech co-production. In cinemascope - requires an anamorphic lense.

results.title: The Sevens Tournament Quick! Quick! Quick!
results.brief_description: Teams from 16 countries including such unlikely contesters as West Samoa, Spain, USA, Japan, South Korea, Holland, Tonga, Romania and Canada, as well as England, Wales, France, Argentina, Fiji, New Zealand and Australia fight it out for the inaugural title. Rated: G

results.title: The Seven year itch
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Charles K. Feldman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A husband of seven years, alone in New York while his family is on vacation, fantasises an affair with the TV model in the upstairs apartment and develops “The seven year itch”. Tortured by guilt, he envisions so many dire consequences that he finally runs off to join his wife. Tom Ewell and Marilyn Monroe star in this tremendous comedy. Based on the play by George Axelrod.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Billy Wilder, Charles K. Feldman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: The Seven Faces of Dr Lao
results.creator_credit: George Pal, George Pal Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Tony Randall plays seven fantastic and magical characters in this imaginative film based on the novel, “The circus of Dr. Lao”, by Charles G. Finney. A mysterious Chinese gentleman, Dr Lao, rides into the western desert town of Abalone. There he sets up a circus in which the townspeople are confronted by physical manifestations of their own fears and desires. With the arrival of Dr Lao the people of Abalone are to change forever. Randall is excellent in all his roles. The film also stars Barbara Eden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Pal, George Pal Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Konigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a claerly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Servant
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Norman Priggen and Springbok Films
results.brief_description: A socio-psychological drama in which a servant, Barratt, is hired by an upper-class, self-centred young man, who has moved into a new house at Chelsea where he plans to live with his fiancee after their marriage. Gradually the relationship of servant and master changes as the latter finds himself slowly falling under Barratt’s control Harold Pinter’s superb study of brooding hatred and hypocrisy within the ever-shifting borders of the class struggle is based on the novel ‘The Servant’ by Robin Maugham. Music by John Dankworth. Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Sarah Miles, Wendy Craig, James Fox.

results.title: The Serpent's Egg
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Dino De Laurentiis and Rialto Film
results.brief_description: Berlin is at boiling point! Money is worthless and fear rules! Through the chaotic madness two people battle to keep their sanity… but what they uncover is far more dangerous than degradation and starvation…the human guinea pigs who risk insanity and death for a square meal. Starring Liv Ullman, David Carradine and James Whitmore.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the poem by Bill and Doreen’s courtship, marriage and move to the country, this version of C.J.Dennis’ verse narrative adds subplot in which Bill saves Doreen’s Uncle Jim from an attempted swindle. Stars Cecil Scott Ray Fisher, Tal Ordell and Athol Tier.

results.title: The Senses of man
results.creator_credit: Indiana University. Audio Visual Center and Gateway Educational Films
results.brief_description: Shows the importance of sense receptors of temperature, pressure, touch and pain. Discusses health considerations pertaining to the senses. A film from the Human Physiology series.

results.title: The Senses
results.creator_credit: Gabor Kalman and Sigma Educational Films
results.brief_description: Hearing, seeing, tasting, smelling, and touching are senses which help animals and birds to know their world. Young children are encouraged to use their senses to enrich the experience of their own environment.
